executive_summary: The values of new residential and nonresidential construction directly contribute to demolition and wrecking demand. Demand for demolition and wrecking services has risen because of broad-based economic growth, a strong housing market and more significant construction activity. Still, due to COVID-19, all nonessential construction activity decreased in the first two quarters of 2020, which caused industry revenue to decline. Poor macroeconomic conditions in 2023 also constrained revenue growth. Still, industry-wide revenue has increased at a CAGR of 2.0% to $9.7 billion through the end of 2024, including an expected 3.3% increase in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Trends in Each Major Downstream Market Help Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Heightened investment in the hot commercial real estate market stands to drive demand for demolition and wrecking to clear land for new construction.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Supply Crunch in Middle-Market and Affordable Housing Units
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The number of housing starts has increased over the last five years, providing an influx of residential contracts for demolition and wrecking companies.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Large-Scale, Lucrative Contracts Continue to be Vital for the Industry's Leaders
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Major demolition and wrecking companies are the only companies with the resources to handle the demolition of massive structures such as arenas and heavy manufacturing plants.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In the coming years, demographic shifts, including a growing urban population, will contribute to expanding housing stock.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: More Companies Offer a More Comprehensive Range of Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Many contractors will emphasize green and eco-friendly practices and services to better accommodate clients' concerns.
Revenue will continue to rise with the expected continuation of the decommissioning of nuclear reactors across the United States.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry primarily wreck and demolish buildings and structures and sometimes sell salvaged materials.
key_trends: Competition is primarily based on price, reputation and range of services.
Contractors with expertise in recycling building materials have an advantage.

market_segmentation.segment_description: The residential market comprises the construction of residential properties.
The nonresidential building includes the demolition of existing obsolete or unused buildings.
Activity in this market is principally associated with site clearance.

products_and_services.product_description: Demolition and wrecking contractors offer abatement and remediation services.
Selective demolition services endure economic uncertainty.

tier_1_suppliers: Construction Machinery Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand from Bridge and Elevated Highway Construction
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demolition and wrecking contractors dismantle old bridges and other large-scale structures.

business_locations.location_description: This region has the largest share of demolition and wrecking contractor establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: OSHA Standard 1926.850(a) requires surveys before work begins.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition is primarily based on price, reputation and range of services.
basis_points.basis_description: Competition among contractors is based on price and reputation.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Larger demolition and wrecking contractors benefit from offering a range of services.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are a growing share of revenue
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Demolition companies hire subcontractors to decrease wage costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Demolition contractors rely on capital equipment.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Revenue trends run in tandem with wider economic conditions
volatility_points.volatility_description: - Revenue fluctuates with demand from residential and commercial construction.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Demolition contractors have limited scope to develop product lines
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Innovation among contractors has remained relatively low.

FAQs.question: Do your sales depend on the overall health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Demand for demolition and wrecking services will be tied to movements in construction activity.
